intro: Rudgea mucronata, commonly known as the Brazilian lily or arrowhead plant, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that are typically pink or white. The plant features lance-shaped leaves and produces small, fragrant blooms that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Rudgea mucronata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
